{"id":1094973375,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"1Â week","timestamp":1699507198,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"19 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1094973375/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Add Two Numbers II","memory":"71.5 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for singly-linked list.\n * struct ListNode {\n *     int val;\n *     ListNode *next;\n *     ListNode() : val(0), next(nullptr) {}\n *     ListNode(int x) : val(x), next(nullptr) {}\n *     ListNode(int x, ListNode *next) : val(x), next(next) {}\n * };\n */\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n   ListNode* reverse(ListNode* l1){\n       ListNode* temp=l1;\n       ListNode* prev= NULL;\n       while(temp){\n           ListNode* nxt = temp->next;\n           temp->next=prev;\n           prev=temp;\n           temp=nxt;\n       }\n       return prev;\n   }\n    ListNode* addTwoNumbers(ListNode* l1, ListNode* l2) {\n        ListNode* a= reverse(l1);\n        ListNode* b= reverse(l2);\n        ListNode* ans= new ListNode(-1);\n        int cnt=0;\n        ListNode* dummy=ans;\n        while(a||b||cnt){\n            int sum =0;\n            sum+= (a?a->val:0)+(b?b->val:0)+cnt;\n              cnt=sum/10;\n            sum=sum%10;\n            ListNode* temp=new ListNode(sum);\n            ans->next=temp;\n            ans=temp;\n            if(a)\n            a=a->next;\n            if(b)\n            b=b->next;\n        }\n      \n        return reverse(dummy->next);\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"add-two-numbers-ii","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
